metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The char data type is used to store a single character. The character must be surrounded by single quotes, like 'A' or 'c':
content.html: The char data type is used to store a single character. The character must be surrounded by single quotes, like 'A' or 'c':

content.code:
char
myGrade
=

'B'
;


System
.
out
.
println
(
myGrade
)
;
content.code_html:
char myGrade = 'B';
System.out.println(myGrade);

content.text: Alternatively, if you are familiar with ASCII values, you can use those to display certain characters:
content.html: Alternatively, if you are familiar with ASCII values, you can use those to display certain characters:

myVar1
=

65
,
myVar2
=

66
,
myVar3
=

67

System
.
out
.

;


System
.
out

println
(

)
;


System

out

println
(

;
content.code_html:
char myVar1 = 65, myVar2 = 66, myVar3 = 67;
System.out.println(myVar1);
System.out.println(myVar2);
System.out.println(myVar3);

content.text: Tip: A list of all ASCII values can be found in our ASCII Table Reference .
content.html: Tip: A list of all ASCII values can be found in our ASCII Table Reference.

content.text: The String data type is used to store a sequence of characters (text). String values must be surrounded by double quotes:
content.html: The String data type is used to store a sequence of characters (text). String values must be surrounded by double quotes:

content.code:
String
greeting
=

"Hello World"
;


System
.
out
.
println
(
greeting
)
;
content.code_html:
String greeting = "Hello World";
System.out.println(greeting);

content.text: The String type is so much used and integrated in Java, that some call it "the special ninth type".
content.html: The String type is so much used and integrated in Java, that some call it "the special ninth type".

content.text: A String in Java is actually a non-primitive data type, because it refers to an object. The String object has methods that are used to perform certain operations on strings. Don't worry if you don't understand the term "object" just yet . We will learn more about strings and objects in a later chapter.
content.html: A String in Java is actually a non-primitive data type, because it refers to an object. The String object has methods that are used to perform certain operations on strings. Don't worry if you don't understand the term "object" just yet. We will learn more about strings and objects in a later chapter.
